sections.doc_:
## Introduction

This sample demonstrates how to implement a simple banner [AMPHTML ad](https://github.com/ampproject/amphtml/blob/master/extensions/amp-a4a/amp-a4a-format.md). In general an AMPHTML ad should be a valid AMP document.

The code represents the body that should be returned as a response initiated through an [amp-ad](/documentation/components/amp-ad) component or otherwise whenever we want to return an AMPHTML ad in any other context.

This example consists of an image and a rendering tracking pixel that are implemented respectively using `amp-img` and `amp-pixel` components.
sections.cachedMarkedDoc:
Introduction

This sample demonstrates how to implement a simple banner AMPHTML ad. In general an AMPHTML ad should be a valid AMP document.

The code represents the body that should be returned as a response initiated through an amp-ad component or otherwise whenever we want to return an AMPHTML ad in any other context.

This example consists of an image and a rendering tracking pixel that are implemented respectively using amp-img and amp-pixel components.
sections.normalizedDoc_:
## Introduction

This sample demonstrates how to implement a simple banner [AMPHTML ad](https://github.com/ampproject/amphtml/blob/master/extensions/amp-a4a/amp-a4a-format.md). In general an AMPHTML ad should be a valid AMP document.

The code represents the body that should be returned as a response initiated through an [amp-ad](/documentation/components/amp-ad) component or otherwise whenever we want to return an AMPHTML ad in any other context.

This example consists of an image and a rendering tracking pixel that are implemented respectively using `amp-img` and `amp-pixel` components.

sections.doc_: As part of any other AMP document, we import the canonical boiler plate to make it a valid AMP document.
sections.normalizedDoc_: As part of any other AMP document, we import the canonical boiler plate to make it a valid AMP document.

sections.doc_: The anatonomy of banner ad is an image with a hyperlink to the advertiser's page. We display the image for the creative using [amp-img](/documentation/components/amp-img).
sections.normalizedDoc_: The anatonomy of banner ad is an image with a hyperlink to the advertiser's page. We display the image for the creative using [amp-img](/documentation/components/amp-img).

sections.doc_:
We include a tracking pixel to record that the ad was rendered using [amp-pixel](/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-pixel-vundefined.md).

Alternatively one could make use of [amp-analytics](/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-analytics-v0.1.md) to enable much more comprenhensive measure activity.
sections.normalizedDoc_:
We include a tracking pixel to record that the ad was rendered using [amp-pixel](/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-pixel-vundefined.md).

Alternatively one could make use of [amp-analytics](/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-analytics-v0.1.md) to enable much more comprenhensive measure activity.

document.head:
<meta charset="utf-8">
  <title>Banner Ad</title>
  <script async src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0.js"></script>
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width,minimum-scale=1,initial-scale=1">
  <style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-moz-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-ms-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both}@-webkit-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-moz-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-ms-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-o-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}</style><noscript><style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:none;-moz-animation:none;-ms-animation:none;animation:none}</style></noscript>
document.title: Banner Ad
document._description: This sample demonstrates how to implement a simple banner AMPHTML ad.
